sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Koch island.
message_1: Suppose you start with an equilateral triangle with side length 27 cm. At each iteration, the middle third of each side is replaced with a smaller equilateral triangle. Find the perimeter of the Koch island after 4 iterations (rounded to the nearest whole number).
message_2:
At each iteration, the middle third of each side is replaced with a smaller equilateral triangle, which adds an additional side to the original triangle. So, after each iteration, the number of sides is multiplied by 4.

After 4 iterations, the number of sides will be:
3 * 4^4 = 3 * 256 = 768 sides

At each iteration, the side length of the new equilateral triangles is one-third of the side length of the previous triangles. After 4 iterations, the side length of the new triangles will be:
27 cm * (1/3)^4 = 27 cm * 1/81 ≈ 0.333 cm

The perimeter of the Koch island after 4 iterations is the product of the number of sides and the side length of the new triangles:
768 * 0.333 ≈ 255.744 cm

Rounded to the nearest whole number, the perimeter of the Koch island after 4 iterations is approximately 256 cm.
